body.name: Bluey: The Videogame- Playstation 5
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 19 hrs 16 mins
features: Play time - Play as Bluey and her family including Chilli, Bingo and Bandit.
Co-op play - Play with your family and friends in a variety of exciting games and challenges.
Explore - Recreate iconic moments from the TV series and immerse yourself in Bluey’s world
body.description: Join the fun with Bluey and her family in Bluey: The Videogame! Play a brand-new story set across 4 interactive adventures. For the first time ever, explore iconic locations such as the Heeler House, Playgrounds, Creek and a bonus beach location. Play your favourite games from the TV show, including Keepy Uppy, Chattermax Chase, and more! The fun doesn't stop there! This game won't be trifficult, just a lot of fun. Experience the joy and wonder of Bluey's world, with local multiplayer you can play with friends and family in story mode and free play! Explore and collect items for your sticker book, unlock outfits and uncover the many secrets and hidden references throughout each location. Recreate iconic scenes or create your very own Bluey inspired adventures and games.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My 7yo niece and 10yo nephew played together and completed the game in about 4 hours. They had a lot of fun and said they recommended it to other Bluey fans. It is also easy enough for my 4yo niece and 2yo nephew to roam around and move the characters. 4yo was also able to do some of the tasks, 2yo was just happy to hold the remote and watch the characters move.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Four year old
reviews.reviewText: My four year old LOVES IT.You have goals to complete to advance to the next playable area, which is fun to achieve. Mini games are adorable but my 4 year old just likes the dress up.It's not really a long winded game. We beat it in a couple hours but repayable ability is endless for youngsters. As mom I enjoyed we could play together

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cute game lots of glitches
reviews.reviewText: To be honest this game looks like it was developed as a phone app and then blown to be a console. It lacks all the major functionality that a modern controller has, in PS5 case it could have use the resistance on the triggers or the trackpad even the microphone and none where used.Seriously under developed, not tested enough, and like i mentioned above full of glitches

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Comically poor execution
reviews.reviewText: Given the quality of the show, I'm surprised the showrunners allowed this game anywhere near release.We had to completely restart the game a couple times (back to main menu, not a full restart) due to it getting stuck in weird places. Gameplay is maybe an hour total. Minigames are very simplistic, which is fine, given the target audience, but they still feel minimal. When you trigger a cutscene (which feels like every 5 seconds) it'll take 15 seconds to start it. So you're left sitting there wondering if it just completely froze or not. Eventually you just get to the point where you're like...oh, must be a cutscene. While we all just look at eachother, and my 7 year old (the staunch Bluey fan) says how bad it is.Deserves 1 star, but I gave it 2 because it actually became comically bad once it reached a certain point.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not good, but not that bad...
reviews.reviewText: Okay so the game isnt good. Buggy and short, but I actually kind of like how the story feels like an episode and I like getting to see the Healer brothers Rad and Uncle Stripe. Just wish you couldn't beat the game in two hours and that was while altered and going for 100% completion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars This game has great potential but is very glitchy
reviews.reviewText: Me and my kids love this game but it glitches a lot. There will be an obvious button to choose and pressing it won’t do anything, we have to start the level all over again to get to the next part.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Very short, buggy, and controls can be frustrated
reviews.reviewText: Kids were very excited about this game. We picked it up yesterday evening, this morning it was already finished.- it is too short, max 2-3 hours if you want to get all the stickers etc- buggy- controls are bad- If a player decides to go into the next room without waiting for others, good luck for the others to join them.I am glad that we only paid $24.99 (Black Friday deal) otherwise I would be even more disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Lacks What Makes the Show Great
reviews.reviewText: Bluey is a phenomenal children’s show that respects your kids’ intelligence with witty writing that the whole family can enjoy. The video game adaptation sadly fails in this regard.The game has the visuals and voices from the show but none of the heart. It is very brief for the price, clocking in only a couple hours of content, even with your young kiddos taking the reins. The objectives are boring and feel like the creators are assuming that your children can’t play a “real” video game yet. This will likely put off kids who have ever held a controller. It may be serviceable as a “my first video game” experience, but there are better options for that as well.Bluey The Videogame is also very glitchy. Characters are constantly getting stuck, freezes frequently occur between cutscenes, and we ran into a few crashes.To its credit, my son is enjoying some of the jokes and he likes dressing up the characters in the various silly hats but I don’t see this one lasting very long. If your child simply has to have the Bluey game, I’d wait until this hits a steep bargain bin.

This was an extremely cute game!! I really enjoyed playing it, and I don't even have kids.My fiance and I are avid Bluey fans as we got hooked on it watching it with our niece. I've since got a few other friends of mine into watching the show who are also childless!This game was easy to play and the story is very cute. I would have loved more games like this when I was a kid. Having 4 players would be a lot of fun and I can imagine how enjoyable it would be to play with kiddos. I'm definitely going to have my niece come over and play it with her.There were some glitches which hopefully can be patched or something, but nothing game breaking. I played as Chilli and every time I got a sticker, it would lag. It also would have been nice to have some variation in voice lines when earning an achievement, but it was still an enjoyable playthrough.I'm not sure I agree with the price point of $50, it feels more like $30 worth of game and quality, but as a Bluey fan, I don't regret buying it.
Esta lindo pero ten en cuenta que el juego se acaba muy rápido
We enjoyed the game and felt like it kept in the spirit of the show. However, it is WAY too short given the price of the game. My five year old had it beaten in under two hours.
